thread.title: Michelle Keegan blasted by viewers on Twitter
thread.title_full: Michelle Keegan blasted by viewers on Twitter

title: Michelle Keegan blasted by viewers on Twitter
text: Share this article Share Before one other added sarcastically: 'Michelle Keegan's having a right whale of a time on #SaturdayNightTakeaway'. 'Michelle Keegan (aka Wright) looks like she can't wait for her shift to be over...not the best guest announcer,' another finished. Awkward: The 29-year-old actress joined the popular entertainment show for their exciting season opener but left audiences wondering if she was 'bored' or 'miserable' following her appearance 'Bored': Many commented that she looked 'bored' throughout her guest announcement Despite the less than stellar feedback, the Our Girl star still mustered up a stream of social media love as many commented on her beauty and skintight black jumpsuit. 'Michelle Keegan is absolutely beautiful,' one Twitter user wrote. 'Michelle Keegan is truly stunning'. While another shared: 'Michelle Keegan looked incredible on Saturday Night Takeaway #girlcrush'. As one last fan echoed many's sentiments online: 'Don't think there's a human alive who doesn't fancy Michelle Keegan'. Loyal: Despite the less than stellar feedback, the Our Girl star still mustered up a stream of social media love as many commented on her beauty and skintight black jumpsuit '#girlcrush': Another admirer shared: 'Michelle Keegan looked incredible on Saturday Night Takeaway #girlcrush' Michelle's 'miserable' appearance wasn't the only awkward moment viewers experience during the TV extravaganza. Veteran host Declan Donnelly was forced to apologise to audiences at home after one contestant got caught up in excitement of the evening's festivites and swore before the watershed. The hosting duo incredibly surprised fans with a holiday to Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida, when one shocked audience member told them to 'f*** off'. Awkward: Michelle's 'miserable' appearance wasn't the only awkward moment viewers experience during the TV extravaganza Earlier in the show, presenter Stephen Mulhern suffered an embarrassing moment when he failed to be shot out of a cannon and was forced to slide back inside. As the camera panned to another area of the vast studio where he should have landed, the dynamic duo looked sheepishly at each other as they realised the camera trick didn't go to plan. Anthony McPartlin explained: 'It was fine in rehearsal!' Before Stephen later giggle that he 'sacked the camera man'. Uh oh: Earlier in the show, presenter Stephen Mulhern suffered an embarrassing moment when he failed to be shot out of a cannon Embarassing: As the camera panned to another area of the vast studio where he should have landed and instead and was forced to slide back inside Sheepish: The dynamic duo looked sheepishly at each other as they realised the camera trick didn't go to plan However the night continued to go down hill for two after Dec tripped over his words, trying to discuss the show's Â£1000 cash prize viewers could win at home. Attempting to say the words 'You could win a whopping 1000 pounds', he was left tongue tied as he hysterical couldn't pronounce the word 'whopping', leaving co-host Ant in a fit of laughter. Dec laughed: 'We'll just cut this bit out!' Giggles: Attempting to say the words 'You could win a whopping 1000 pounds', he was left tongue tied as he hysterical couldn't pronounce the word 'whopping', leaving co-host Ant in a fit of laughter
